title: Amaranth For Breakfast
summary: Amaranth For Breakfast might be a good recipe to expand your morn meal recipe box. Watching your figure? This gluten free and vegan recipe has 669 calories, 15g of protein, and 26g of fat per serving. For $3.18 per serving, this recipe covers 23% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 1. 1 person found this recipe to be scrumptious and satisfying. It is brought to you by Recipezaar. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 25 minutes. A mixture of agave nectar, coconut milk, cinnamon, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so flavorful. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 70%. This score is good. Similar recipes are On the Job: Amaranth Breakfast Porridge with Blueberry Compote, Spinach Almond Amaranth Breakfast Muffins, and amaranth yogurt parfait â€“ popped amaranth parfait with fruits.
instructions: Cook the amaranth (this may be done the night before): Mix the water and amaranth in a saucepan and heat to boiling.Turn heat to low, and let simmer for 20-25 minute Most of the water should be absorbed. Take care at the end of the cooking time, because it may get too dry and burn. You should still see the individual grains of amaranth, although they will stick together a little. Overcooking will turn the amaranth to mush.Cooked amaranth will keep in the refrigerator overnight, if necessary.In the morning, reheat the amaranth in the microwave, if necessary. Drizzle the amaranth with honey, sprinkle with cinnamon, and pour the coconut milk on top.

steps.step: Mix the water and amaranth in a saucepan and heat to boiling.Turn heat to low, and let simmer for 20-25 minute Most of the water should be absorbed. Take care at the end of the cooking time, because it may get too dry and burn. You should still see the individual grains of amaranth, although they will stick together a little. Overcooking will turn the amaranth to mush.Cooked amaranth will keep in the refrigerator overnight, if necessary.In the morning, reheat the amaranth in the microwave, if necessary.
Drizzle the amaranth with honey, sprinkle with cinnamon, and pour the coconut milk on top.
